reviews.review_msg: Professor Olyaei is an amazing prof and easily one of the best profs I've had. She did an amazing job in making the lectures and course material easy to understand and gave great feedback despite the course being online. She is also very accessible for help outside of class and wants her students to succeed. Lectures and textbook are important.

Professor Olyaei was one of the most caring profs I've had at SFU. She wants her students to excel and helps them out by giving clear instructions, being open to class suggestions, and is very accessible for help. Although the class content was quite dense &detailed, the readings and lectures were very clear! Would definitely recommend this course!

Dr. Olyaei is absolutely a stand-out professor! She cares a lot about her students and puts a lot of effort into conducting her lectures. Please make it a point to catch her during her office hours for clarifications/advice. Not only will she give you course-related advice, but she will help you map out your career priorities if you need it.

This professor is a professor who takes the students well being and success as her highest priority. Her lectures are clear and specific no unnecessary information is given and her homework as well as all her quizzes are clear and straight to the point. To succeed in this class, carefully follow instructions and participate. Lectures are important

Dr. Olyaei is a very understanding and caring professor who tries her best to ensure all students' needs are met. The assignments and tests are graded fairly easily, and all exam contents are derived from the text book. The text from Webber is easy to understand, straightforward and concise. If you do your readings, you're guaranteed a good grade.

She is a great professor: clear, caring, sweet. She wants everyone's questions to be answered so she encourages talking with her through email or office hours. She is inspirational, articulate, passionate, and approachable. The course structure is quite well organized. It's not hard to do well.

Shiva is absolutely wonderful. She is such a soft spoken and caring lady. She wants nothing more than for you to succeed. Although the course concepts can be tricky, she is always available for questions. Just an overall good person.

You can tell she really cares about her students and enjoys teaching. Gives great feedback and wants people to succeed in her class. Very accessible through email and always answers quickly. Just a very genuinely nice person.

Shiva was a good instructor. It was her first semester at SFU and she had some kinks to get out, but she did well. She's super kind and caring and tries to cover ground in lectures that will help people with their papers. The final paper was worth 45% though, so I wouldn't recommend her classes to people who aren't good writers.
